The string contins the lengths of the arrays of data defining this geometry.

field.name: aFacesNormals

interfaceRec.name: INodeOperation
interfaceRec.description:
Interface for node operations.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.
interfaceRec.author: flexrails
interfaceRec.example:
<listing version="3.1">
      var mySpecialOperation:SpecialOperation = new SpecialOperation;
  
      mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.8;
      someTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
      trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
  
      mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.2;
      someOtherTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
      trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
  </listing>

method.name: performOnEntry
method.description: Operation to be performed on node entry
method.param: p_oNode The node the entry operation is to be performed on

method.name: performOnExit
method.description: Operation to be performed on node exit
method.param: p_oNode The node the exit operation is to be performed on

classRec.name: Node
classRec.description:
ABSTRACT CLASS - Base class for all nodes in the object tree.

The base class for all Group and object nodes, that handles all basic operations on a tree node.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Node
method.description:
Creates a node in the object tree of the world.

This constructor should normally not be called directly, only from a sub class.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object.

method.name: addChild
method.description:
Adds a new child to this node.

A node can have several children, and when you add a child to a node, it is automatically connected to the parent node through its parent property.
method.param: p_oChild The child node to add

method.name: addEventListener
method.description: Adds a listener for the specified event.
method.param: p_sEvt Name of the Event.
p_oL Listener object.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the frustum volume to get its visibility.

If the node and its children aren't in the frustum, the node is set to cull and will not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes, to make a more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform a more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.param: p_oScene The current scene which is rendered
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera.
p_oViewMatrix The matrix which maps object local coordinates into camera coordinates.
p_bChanged Flag which specifies if parent transformation have changed to enable the matrix cache system when set to false.

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

method.name: getChildByName
method.description: Returns the child node with the specified name.
method.param: p_sName The name of the child you want to retrieve
p_bRecurs Set to true if you want to search the the children for the requested node
method.return: The requested node or null if no child with this name was found

method.name: hasParent
method.description: Tests if this node has a parent.
method.return: true if this node has a parent, false otherwise.

method.name: isParent
method.description: Tests if the node passed in the argument is parent of this node.
method.param: p_oNode The node you are testing
method.return: true if the node in the argument is the parent of this node, false otherwise.

method.name: perform
method.description:
Performs an operation on this node and all of its children.

Traverses the subtree made up of this node and all of its children. While traversing the subtree, individual operations are performed on entry and exit of each node of the subtree.

Implements the visitor design pattern: Using the visitor design pattern, you can define a new operation on Node and its subclasses without having to change the classes and without having to take care of traversing the node tree.
method.example:
<listing version="3.1">
       var mySpecialOperation:SpecialOperation = new SpecialOperation;
   
       mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.8;
       someTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
       trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
   
       mySpecialOperation.someParameter = 0.2;
       someOtherTreeNode.perform(mySpecialOperation);
       trace(mySpecialOperation.someResult);
   </listing>
method.param: p_iOperation The operation to be performed on the node subtree

method.name: remove
method.description:
Removes this node from the node tree, saving its child nodes.

NOTE that remove method only remove the current node and NOT its children!
To remove the current node and all its children please refer to the destroy method.

The child nodes of this node becomes child nodes of this node's parent.

method.name: removeChildByName
method.description:
Removes the child node with the specified name.

All children of the node you want to remove are lost.
The link between them and the rest of the tree is broken, and they will not be rendered anymore!

The object itself and its children are still in memory!
If you want to free them completely, call child.destroy()
method.param: p_sName The name of the node you want to remove.
method.return: true if the node was removed from node tree, false otherwise.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.description: Removes a listener for the specified event.
method.param: p_sEvt Name of the Event.
oL Listener object.

method.name: swapParent
method.description:
Moves this node to another parent node.

This node is removed from its current parent node, and added as a child of the specified node
method.param: p_oNewParent The node to become parent of this node

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object
method.return: The fully qualified name of this class

method.name: update
method.description:
Updates this node.

For a node with transformation, this method update the transformation taking into account the matrix cache system.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oModelMatrix
p_bChanged

method.name: updateBoundingVolumes
method.description: Updates the bounding volumes of this object. NO IMPLEMENTATION RIGHT NOW. MIGHT BE USED IN THE FUTURE

method.name: broadcaster
method.description:
The broadcaster

The broadcaster is used to send events to listeners.
This property is a BubbleEventBroadcaster.
method.return: The instance of the current node broadcaster.

method.name: changed
method.description: This property set the cache status of the current node. IMPORTANT Currently this property IS IN USE FOR CACHE SYSTEM

method.name: parent
method.description:
The parent node of this node.

The reference is null if this nod has no parent (for exemple for a root node).

method.name: appearance
method.description: Set that appearance to all the children of that node

method.name: enableBackFaceCulling
method.description: Change the backface culling state to all the shapes objects in the children list

method.name: enableClipping
method.description: Apply clipping to all the children of that node
method.param: p_bUseClipping if true, the clipping will be used on that object and all its children if any

method.name: enableEvents
method.description: Enable event handling to all the children objects that can broadcast bubbling events

method.name: enableInteractivity
method.description: Change the interactivity of all the children

method.name: scene
method.description: Reference to the scene is it linked to. Initialized at null.

method.name: useSingleContainer
method.description: Make all the Shape3D and descendants children react to this value.
method.param: p_bUseSingleContainer if true, the whole objects will use a container to display the geometry into, otherwise, a specific container will be given to each polygon

method.name: visible
method.description: Specify the visibility of this node. If true, the node is visible, if fase, it will not be displayed.

field.name: boundingBox
field.description: The bounding box of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

field.name: boundingSphere
field.description: The bounding sphere of this node IMPORTANT: Do not modify it unless you perfectly know what you are doing

field.name: children
field.description: The children of this node are stored inside this array. IMPORTANT: Use this property mainly as READ ONLY. To add, delete or search a specific child, you can use the specific method to do that

field.name: culled
field.description: This property represent the culling state of the current node. This state is defined during the culling phasis as it refers to the position of the object against the viewing frustum.

field.name: id
field.description:
The unique id of this node in the node graph.

This value is very useful to retrieve a specific node.

field.name: modelMatrix
field.description: Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the 0,0,0 frame system

field.name: name
field.description: Name of this node. If no name is specified, the unique ID of the node will be used

field.name: viewMatrix
field.description: Cached matrix corresponding to the transformation to the camera frame system

interfaceRec.name: Renderable
interfaceRec.description: Interface which specifies the element can be rendererd by a Sandy3D Camera3D object.
interfaceRec.author: thomas

classRec.name: ATransformable
classRec.description:
ABSTRACT CLASS - super class for all movable objects in the object tree.

This class should not be directly instatiated, but sub classed.
The Atransformable class is resposible for scaling, rotation and translation of objects in 3D space.

Rotations and translations are performed in one of three coordinate systems or reference frames:
- The local frame which is the objects own coordinate system
- The parent frame which is the coordinate system of the object's parent, normally a TransformGroup
- The world frame which is the coordinate system of the world, the global system.

Positions, directions, translations and rotations of an ATransformable object are performed in its parent frame.
Tilt, pan and roll, are rotations around the local axes, and moveForward, moveUpwards and moveSideways are translations along local axes.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: ATransformable
method.description:
Creates a transformable node in the object tree of the world.

This constructor should normally not be called directly, but from a sub class.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object

method.name: getLookAt
method.description: getLookAt - obtain last value set via lookAt() method; may not be valid if other camera movement has occurred since then.

method.name: getPosition
method.description:
Returns the position of this group or object.

Choose which coordinate system the returned position refers to, by passing a mode string:
The position is returned as a Point3D in one of the following:
If "local", the position is coordinates of the parent frame. If "absolute" the position is in world coordinates If "camera" the position is relative to the camera's coordinate system. Default value is "local"
method.return: The position of the group or object

method.name: initFrame
method.description:
Initiates the local coordinate system for this object.

The local coordinate system for this object is set parallell the parent system.

method.name: lookAt
method.description:
Makes this object "look at" the specified position in the parent frame.

Useful for following a moving object or a static object while this object is moving.
Normally used when this object is a camera
method.param: p_nX Number The x position to look at
p_nY Number The y position to look at
p_nZ Number The z position to look at

method.name: lookAtPoint
method.description:
The position in the parent frame this object should "look at".

Useful for following a moving object or a static object while this object is moving.
Normally used when this object is a camera

method.name: moveForward
method.description:
Translates this object along its forward Point3D ( local z ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step forward
in the direction you look, not always horizontally!
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: moveHorizontally
method.description:
Translates this object parallel to its parent zx plane and in its forward direction.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step in the forward direction, but without changing your altitude ( constant global z ).
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: moveLateraly
method.description:
Translates this object laterally in its parent frame.

This is a translation in the parent's x direction.
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: moveSideways
method.description:
Translates this object along its side Point3D ( local x ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step to your right or to your left
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: moveUpwards
method.description:
Translates this object along its up Point3D ( local y ) in the parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a step up or down
in the direction of your body, not always vertically!
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: moveVertically
method.description:
Translates this object vertically in ots parent frame.

If you imagine yourself in the world, it would be a strictly vertical step, ( in the global y direction )
method.param: p_nD How far to move

method.name: resetCoords
method.description: Resets the coordinate system for this object. Useful for returning to known state.

method.name: rotateAxis
method.description:
Rotate this object around the specified axis in the parent frame by the specified angle.

NOTE : The axis will be normalized automatically.
method.param: p_nX The x coordinate of the axis
p_nY The y coordinate of the axis
p_nZ The z coordinate of the axis
p_nAngle The angle of rotation in degrees.

method.name: setPosition
method.description: Sets the position of this object in coordinates of its parent frame.
method.param: p_nX The x coordinate
p_nY The y coordiante
p_nZ The z coordiante

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object
method.return: The fully qualified name of this class

method.name: translate
method.description: Translate this object from it's current position with the specified offsets.
method.param: p_nX Offset that will be added to the x coordinate of the object
p_nY Offset that will be added to the y coordinate of the object
p_nZ Offset that will be added to the z coordinate of the object

method.name: update
method.description:
Updates this node or object.

For node's with transformation, this method updates the transformation taking into account the matrix cache system.
FIXME: Transformable nodes shall upate their transform if necessary before calling this method.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oModelMatrix The matrix which represents the parent model matrix. Basically it stores the rotation/translation/scale of all the nodes above the current one.
p_bChanged A boolean value which specify if the state has changed since the previous rendering. If false, we save some matrix multiplication process.

method.name: updateTransform
method.description: Updates the transform matrix of the current object/node before it is rendered.

method.name: out
method.description: Forward direction ( local z ) in parent coordinates.

method.name: scaleX
method.description:
x scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original x scale, a value of 2 doubles the x scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.

method.name: scaleY
method.description:
y scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original y scale, a value of 2 doubles the y scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.

method.name: scaleZ
method.description:
z scale of this object.

A value of 1 scales to the original z scale, a value of 2 doubles the z scale.
NOTE : This value does not affect the camera object.

method.name: side
method.description: Side direction ( local x ) in parent coordinates.

method.name: tilt
method.description: Getter for the tilt value

method.name: up
method.description: Up direction ( local y ) in parent coordinates.

method.name: x
method.description: x position of this object in its parent frame.

method.name: y
method.description: y position of this object in its parent frame.

method.name: z
method.description: z position of the node in its parent frame.

method.name: matrix
method.description: This property allows you to directly set the matrix you want to a transformable object. But be careful with its use. It modifies the rotation AND the position. WARNING : Please remove any scale from this matrix. This is not managed yet. WARNING : Please think about call initFrame before changing this frame. Without calling this method first, the frame will stay local, and the transformation will be applied locally.
method.param: p_oMatrix The new local matrix for this node

method.name: pan
method.description:
Pans this object around the local y axis.

The pan angle interval is 0 to 360 degrees
Directions within the parent frame are: North = 0, East = 90, South = 180 nad West = 270 degrees.
method.param: p_nAngle The pan angle in degrees.

method.name: roll
method.description:
Rolls this object around the local z axis.

The roll angle interval is -180 to +180 degrees
At 0 degrees the local x axis is aligned with the horizon of its parent
Full roll right = 180 and full roll left = -180 degrees ( upside down ).
method.param: p_nAngle The roll angle in degrees.

method.name: rotateX
method.description:
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's x axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the x axis of the parent frame.

method.name: rotateY
method.description:
Rotates this object around an axis parallel to the parent's y axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, parallel to the y axis of the parent frame.

method.name: rotateZ
method.description:
Rotates this object around an axis paralell to the parent's z axis.

The object rotates a specified angle ( degrees ) around an axis through the objects reference point, paralell to the z axis of the parent frame.

method.name: tilt
method.description:
Tilts this object around the local x axis.

The tilt angle interval is -90 to +90 degrees
At 0 degrees the local z axis is paralell to the zx plane of its parent coordinate system.
Straight up = +90 and stright down = -90 degrees.
method.param: p_nAngle The tilt angle in degrees.

field.name: disable
field.description: Disable the local transformations applied to this Node if set to false. They will be applied back once et back to true.

field.name: invModelMatrix
field.description:
Inverse of the model matrix The matrix is inverted in comparison of the real model matrix.
For example, this allows replacement of the objects in the correct camera frame before projection

classRec.name: TransformGroup
classRec.description:
The TransformGroup class is used to create transform group.

It represents a node in the object tree of the world.
Transformations performed on this group are applied to all its children.

The class is final, i.e. it can not be subclassed.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: TransformGroup
method.description: Creates a transform group.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera
p_oViewMatrix The view martix of the curren camera
p_bChanged

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of the TransformGroup.

classRec.name: Group
classRec.description:
The Group class is used for branch nodes in the Sandy object tree.

This class is fianl, and can not be sub classed

This group binds together, but can not transform its children.
To transform collections of objects, you should add them to a transform group.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Group
method.description: Creates a branch group.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is culled and will not be displayed.

This method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera
p_oViewMatrix The view martix of the curren camera
p_bChanged

classRec.name: Camera3D
classRec.description:
The Camera3D class is used to create a camera for the Sandy world.

As of this version of Sandy, the camera is added to the object tree, which means it is transformed in the same manner as any other object.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Camera3D
method.description:
Creates a camera for projecting visible objects in the world.

By default the camera shows a perspective projection.
The camera is at -300 in z axis and look at the world 0,0,0 point.
method.param: p_nWidth Width of the camera viewport in pixels
p_nHeight Height of the camera viewport in pixels
p_nFov The vertical angle of view in degrees - Default 45
p_nNear The distance from the camera to the near clipping plane - Default 50
p_nFar The distance from the camera to the far clipping plane - Default 10000

method.name: cull
method.description: Nothing to do - the camera can't be culled

method.name: destroy
method.description: Delete the camera node and clear its displaylist.

method.name: projectArray
method.description: Project the vertices list given in parameter. The vertices are projected to the screen, as a 2D position. A cache system is used here to prevent multiple projection of the same vertex. In case you want to redo a projection, prefer projectVertex method which doesn't use a cache system.

method.name: projectVertex
method.description: Project the vertex passed as parameter. The vertices are projected to the screen, as a 2D position.

method.name: setPerspectiveProjection
method.description:
Sets a projection matrix with perspective.

This projection allows a natural visual presentation of objects, mimicking 3D perspective.
method.param: p_nFovY The angle of view in degrees - Default 45.
p_nAspectRatio The ratio between vertical and horizontal dimension - Default the viewport ratio (width/height)
p_nZNear The distance betweeen the camera and the near plane - Default 10.
p_nZFar The distance betweeen the camera position and the far plane. Default 10 000.

method.name: update
method.description: Updates the state of the camera transformation.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oModelMatrix The matrix which represents the parent model matrix. Basically it stores the rotation/translation/scale of all the nodes above the current one.
p_bChanged A boolean value which specify if the state has changed since the previous rendering. If false, we save some matrix multiplication process.

method.name: updatePerspective
method.description: Updates the perspective projection.

method.name: invProjectionMatrix
method.description: Returns the inverse of the projection matrix of this camera.

method.name: projectionMatrix
method.description: Returns the projection matrix of this camera.

method.name: far
method.description: Far plane distance for culling/clipping.

method.name: focalLength
method.description:
Focal length of camera.

This value is a function of fov angle and viewport dimensions. Writing this value changes fov angle only.

method.name: fov
method.description: The angle of view of this camera in degrees.

method.name: near
method.description: Near plane distance for culling/clipping.

field.name: frustrum
field.description: The frustum of the camera.

field.name: viewport
field.description: The camera viewport

classRec.name: SpringCamera3D
classRec.author: b at turbulent dot carbulent.ca - http://agit8.tu

method.name: SpringCamera3D
method.description: Constructor.
method.param: p_nWidth Width of the camera viewport in pixels.
p_nHeight Height of the camera viewport in pixels.
fov This value is the vertical Field Of View (FOV) in degrees.
near Distance to the near clipping plane.
far Distance to the far clipping plane.

method.name: zrot
method.description: Rotation in degrees along the camera Z vector to apply to the camera after it turns towards the target .

field.name: _camTarget
field.description: [optional] Target object3d that camera should follow. If target is null, camera behaves just like a normal Camera3D.

field.name: damping
field.description: Damping is the spring internal friction, or how much it resists the "boinggggg" effect. Too high and you'll lose it! A number between 1 and 20 is recommended.

field.name: lookOffset
field.description: offset of facing in target object space, ie: where in the target object space should the camera look.

field.name: mass
field.description: Mass of the camera, if over 120 and it'll be very heavy to move.

field.name: positionOffset
field.description: Offset of spring center from target in target object space, ie: Where the camera should ideally be in the target object space.

field.name: stiffness
field.description: Stiffness of the spring, how hard is it to extend. The higher it is, the more "fixed" the cam will be. A number between 1 and 20 is recommended.

classRec.name: Sound3D
classRec.description: Transform audio volume and pan relative to the Camera3D
classRec.author: Daniel Reitterer - Delta 9

method.name: Sound3D
method.description: Creates a 3D sound object wich can be placed in the 3d scene. Set stereo to true if the sound source is in stereo. If stereo is true, both channels are at the same position in 3d space, but the stereo panorama is kept and mirrored if required. To create a true stereo effect, take two Sound3D instances and two mono sound sources on different locations in 3d space.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object
p_oSoundSource The sound source, a String, UrlRequest, Sound or a SoundChannel object
p_nVolume Volume of the sound
p_nMaxPan Max pan of the sound, if zero panning is disabled
p_nRadius Radius of the sound in 3d units
p_bStereo If the sound contains two different channels

method.name: cPlay
method.description: Play the sound if the camera enters the culling sphere with the sound radius. This method should not be called if mode is "channel"
method.param: isUrl true if thr urlReq should be loaded

method.name: play
method.description: Start Sound sources of type Sound or UrlRequest. Sound sources of type SoundChannel don't support the play method
method.param: p_nStartTime
p_iLoops

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the sound source and SoundChannel

method.name: isFlipped
method.description: Returns true if the stereo panorama is mirrored, flipPan have to be true to enable stereo flipping

method.name: soundSource
method.description: Returns the sound source, the sound source may be a URLRequest, Sound or SoundChannel object

method.name: soundSource
method.description: Set the sound source, the sound source can be a String, URLRequest, Sound or SoundChannel object

field.name: flipPan
field.description: If flipPan is true the left and right channels of the sound are mirrored if the camera is facing away from the sound

field.name: loopStartTime
field.description: Start time to play the audio from if the sound loops

field.name: loops
field.description: Number of loops before the sound stops

field.name: maxPan
field.description: Maximal pan is a positive Number from 0-1 or higher

field.name: soundPan
field.description: If pan is true the panning of the sound is relative to the camera rotation

field.name: soundRadius
field.description: The radius of the sound

field.name: soundVolume
field.description: Max volume of the sound if camera position is at sound position

field.name: startTime
field.description: The start time to play the audio from

field.name: stereo
field.description: If the sound contains two channels, stereo have to be set to true in order to mix left and right channels correctly

field.name: type
field.description: Type is either SPEECH or NOISE, SPEECH will start the sound at the last position if the camera enters the sphere of the sound

interfaceRec.name: IDisplayable
interfaceRec.description:
The IDisplayable interface should be implemented by all visible objects.
<This ensures that all necessary methods are implemented>
interfaceRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

classRec.name: Sprite2D
classRec.description:
The Sprite2D class is used to create a 2D sprite.

A Sprite2D object is used to display a static or dynamic texture in the Sandy world.
The sprite always shows the same side to the camera. This is useful when you want to show more or less complex images, without heavy calculations of perspective distortion.

The Sprite2D has a fixed bounding sphere radius, set by default to 30.
In case your sprite is bigger, you can adjust it to avoid any frustum culling issue
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Sprite2D
method.description: Creates a Sprite2D.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object
p_oContent The container containing all the pre-rendered picture

p_nScale A number used to change the scale of the displayed object. In case that the object projected dimension isn't adapted to your needs. Default value is 1.0 which means unchanged. A value of 2.0 will double object size. A value of 0 will force original graphics size independent of distance.

method.name: clear
method.description:
Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

The the graphics that were drawn on the Graphics object is erased, and the fill and line style settings are reset.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera
p_oViewMatrix The view martix of the curren camera
p_bChanged

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

method.name: display
method.description:
Displays this sprite.

display the object onto the scene. If the object has autocenter enabled, sprite center is set at screen position. Otherwise the sprite top left corner will be at that position.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oContainer The container to draw on

method.name: remove
method.description: Provide the classical remove behaviour, plus remove the container to the display list.

method.name: setBoundingSphereRadius
method.description: Sets the radius of bounding sphere for this sprite.
method.param: p_nRadius The radius

method.name: container
method.description: The container of this sprite ( canvas )

method.name: content
method.description: Gives access to your content reference. The content is the exact visual object you passed to the constructor. In comparison with the container which is the container of the content (in Sandy's architecture, the container must be a Sprite), but the content can be any kind of visual object AS3 offers (MovieClip, Bitmap, Sprite etc.) WARNNIG: Be careful when manipulating the content object to not break any link with the sandy container (content.parent).

method.name: depth
method.description:
The depth to draw this sprite at.

[ToDo: Explain ]

method.name: material
method.description: Material that the sprite will be dressed in. Use it to apply some attributes to sprite, such as light attributes.

method.name: scale
method.description:
The scale of this sprite.

Using scale, you can change the dimension of the sprite rapidly.

method.name: content
method.description: The DisplayObject that will used as content of this Sprite2D. If this DisplayObject has already a screen position, it will be reseted to 0,0. If the DisplayObject has allready a parent, it will be unrelated from it automatically. (its transform matrix property is resetted to identity too).
method.param: p_content The DisplayObject to attach to the Sprite2D#container.

field.name: autoCenter
field.description: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its graphical center. Otherwise the sprite positioning is controlled by floorCenter property.

field.name: enableForcedDepth
field.description:
Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

If true it is possible to force this object to be drawn at a specific depth,
if false the normal Z-sorting algorithm is applied.

When correctly used, this feature allows you to avoid some Z-sorting problems.

field.name: fixedAngle
field.description: Set this to true if you want this sprite to rotate with camera.

field.name: floorCenter
field.description: When enabled, the sprite will be displayed at its bottom line. Otherwise it is positioned at its registration point (usually top left corner). This property has no effect when autoCenter is enabled.

field.name: forcedDepth
field.description:
The forced depth for this object.

To make this feature work, you must enable the ForcedDepth system too.
The higher the depth is, the sooner the more far the object will be represented.

classRec.name: Shape3D
classRec.description:
The Shape3D class is the base class of all true 3D shapes.

It represents a node in the object tree of the world.
A Shape3D is a leaf node and can not have any child nodes.

It must be the child of a branch group or a transform group, but transformations can be applied to the Shape directly.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Shape3D
method.description:
Creates a 3D object

This creates a new 3D geometry object. That object will handle the rendering of a static Geometry3D object into a real 3D object and finally to the 2D camera representation.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object
p_oGeometry The geometry of this object
p_oAppearance The appearance of this object. If no apperance is given, the DEFAULT_APPEARANCE will be applied.
p_bUseSingleContainer Whether tis object should use a single container to draw on

method.name: clear
method.description:
Clears the graphics object of this object's container.

The the graphics that were drawn on the Graphics object is erased, and the fill and line style settings are reset.

method.name: clone
method.description: This method returns a clone of this Shape3D. The current appearance will be applied, and the geometry is cloned (not referenced to curent one).
method.param: p_sName The name of the new shape you are going to create
p_bKeepTransform Boolean value which, if set to true, applies the current local transformations to the cloned shape. Default value is false.

method.name: cull
method.description:
Tests this node against the camera frustum to get its visibility.

If this node and its children are not within the frustum, the node is set to cull and it would not be displayed.

The method also updates the bounding volumes to make the more accurate culling system possible.
First the bounding sphere is updated, and if intersecting, the bounding box is updated to perform the more precise culling.

[MANDATORY] The update method must be called first!
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera
p_oViewMatrix The view martix of the curren camera
p_bChanged

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroy this object and all its faces container object is removed, and graphics cleared. All polygons have their

method.name: display
method.description:
Performs a z-sorting and renders the objects visible polygons.

The method is called only if the object renders on a single container
- ( useSingleContainer = true ).
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oContainer The container to draw on

method.name: setConvexFlag
method.description: Sets SORT_NONE or SORT_AVGZ sorting mode. Deprecated.
method.internal: this is now here for backward compatibility only.

method.name: swapCulling
method.description:
Changes the backface culling side.

When you want to display a cube and you are the cube, you see its external faces.
The internal faces are not drawn due to back face culling

In case you are inside the cube, by default Sandy's engine still doesn't draw the internal faces (because you should not be in there).

If you need to be only inside the cube, you can call this method to change which side is culled.
The faces will be visible only from the interior of the cube.

If you want to be both on the inside and the outside, you want to make the faces visible from on both sides.
In that case you just have to set enableBackFaceCulling to false.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.return: The fully qualified name of this object and its geometry.

method.name: updateBoundingVolumes
method.description: Updates the bounding volumes of this object.

method.name: container
method.description: The contianer for this object. This container property exist if the useSingleContainer is set to true. It is a direct access to the Shape3D container to, for example, apply nice effects such as filters etc.

method.name: depth
method.description: The depth of this object. In case the useSingleContainer mode is enabled (default mode), this value returns the means depth of the Shape in the camera frame. This value is mainly used as a z-sorting value.

method.name: geometryCenter
method.description: This property call allows you to get the geometryCenter offset Point3D of the Shape. Modifying this Point3D will impact the way the shape is rendered, mainly its rotation center.
method.return: a Point3D which corresponds to the 2 directions offset.

method.name: material
method.description: Returns the material currently used by the renderer
method.return: Material the material used to render

method.name: sortingMode
method.description: Faces sorting method. With useSingleContainer set to false only SORT_AVGZ is possible.

method.name: appearance
method.description: Set the appearance of this object. NOTE: Please mind that Sandy3D allows to set an appearance at a polygon level.
method.param: p_oApp The appearance object which stores the front material and -if set- the back material which represents that shape.

method.name: enableBackFaceCulling
method.description:
Should back face culling be enabled for this object?.

If set to false all faces of this object are drawn.
A true value enables the back face culling algorithm - Default true

method.name: enableClipping
method.description:
Enable the Frustum clipping on the visible polygons. Enable this when you need a perfect intersection between the camera and some object shapes. In case you need to make the camera look inside and outide a box, or other immerssive things.

Important: Enable the clipping makes process a bit slower, especially with big scenes.

Specify if this object polygons should be clipped against the camera frustum planes.

method.name: enableEvents
enableInteractivity
method.description:
Enable the interactivity on this shape and its polygon. Be careful, this mode have some requirements : - to have useSingleContainer set to false. It is done automatically if enabled
The original settings are back to their original state when the mode is disabled

method.name: geometry
method.description: The geometry of this object.

method.name: geometryCenter
method.description:
Change the geometryCenter of the Shape3D. To change the geometryCenter point of a shape, simply set this geometryCenter property. The geometryCenter property requires a Point3D. This Point3D is an position offset relative to the original geometry one. For example, a Sphere primitive creates automatically a geometry which center is the 0,0,0 position. If you rotate this sphere as this, it will rotate around its center. Now if you set the geometryCenter property, this rotation center will change.
The updateBoundingVolumes method which does update the bounding volumes to enable a correct frustum culling is automatically called.

method.name: scene
method.description: Reference to the scene is it linked to. Initialized at null.

method.name: useSingleContainer
method.description:
setter that allow user to change the way to render this object. set to true, the shape will be rendered into a single Sprite object, which is accessible through the container property. set to false, the container property does not target anything, but all the polygons will be rendered into their own dedidated container.

If true, this object renders itself on a single container ( Sprite ),
if false, each polygon is rendered on its own container.

field.name: SORT_AVGZ
field.description: Average distance sorting. Default sorting mode. Carefully designed models will display just fine, but ordering problems are common. This is also the only possible sorting mode with useSingleContainer set to false.

field.name: SORT_CUSTOM_BSP
field.description: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no tree is built for you (you need to set bsp property yourself). Experimental.

field.name: SORT_LAZY_BSP
field.description: In this mode mesh is sorted using BSP tree, but no faces are split for you (means sorting problems are still possible). Experimental.

field.name: SORT_NONE
field.description: No sorting. Only convex shapes are guaranteed to display correctly in this mode.

field.name: aPolygons
field.description: The array of polygons building this object.

field.name: aVisiblePolygons
field.description: Array containing the visible polygons of that shape. Contente is available after the SCENE_RENDER_DISPLAYLIST event of the current scene has been dispatched

field.name: animated
field.description:
Animated flag.

If the geometry vertices are dynamically modified by some animation engine or mathematic function, some polygon may disapear with no reason. The normal Point3D is used to compute the polygon visibility, and if you don't update the normal Point3D after the vertices modifications, there's an error. To fix that problem, Sandy3D offers that new property appeared in 3.0.3 release, which once set to true, automatically update the normal Point3Ds for you. As a performance warning, don't set this value to true if your model geometry isn't animated.

field.name: bsp
field.description: Root node of BSP tree.

field.name: enableForcedDepth
field.description:
Should forced depth be enable for this object?.

If true it is possible to force this object to be drawn at a specific depth,
if false the normal Z-sorting algorithm is applied.

When correctly used, this feature allows you to avoid some Z-sorting problems.

field.name: enableNearClipping
field.description:
Enable the Frustum near plane clipping on the visible polygons. Enable this when you need a perfect intersection between the front camera plane. This is mainly used when you need the camera to move on a long plane.

Important: Enable the clipping makes process a bit slower, especially with big scenes.

field.name: forcedDepth
field.description:
The forced depth for this object.

To make this feature work, you must enable the ForcedDepth system too.
The higher the depth is, the sooner the more far the object will be represented.

field.name: m_oGeometry
field.description: Geometry of this object

classRec.name: StarField
classRec.description: The StarField class renders dense star field at reasonable FPS.
classRec.author: makc

Event.name: afterRender
Event.description: Dispatched when after BitmapData object is unlocked.

Event.name: beforeRender
Event.description: Dispatched when after BitmapData object is locked and normally about to be cleared.

method.name: StarField
method.description: Creates a StarField.
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object

method.name: clear
method.description: Clearing is done in render() method.

method.name: cull
method.description: This tests for stars visibility.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oFrustum The frustum of the current camera
p_oViewMatrix The view martix of the curren camera
p_bChanged

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Delete this node and all its child nodes.

This node nad all its child nodes are deleted, including all data they are storing.
The method makes recursive calls to the destroy method of the child nodes.

method.name: display
method.description: Displays the starfield.
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oContainer The container to draw on

method.name: remove
method.description: Provide the classical remove behaviour, plus remove the container to the display list.

method.name: render
method.description: Renders the starfield
method.param: p_oScene The current scene
p_oCamera The current camera

method.name: container
method.description: The container of this object

method.name: depth
method.description: The depth to draw the starfield at. If depthIndex is set to valid value, depth returns distance to that star, otherwise value set by user (default: 1e10).

field.name: depthIndex
field.description: An index in stars array; if set to valid value, depth returns distance to that star.

field.name: fadeFrom
field.description: Distance from screen where stars start to fade out

field.name: fadeTo
field.description: Distance from fadeFrom to the point where stars fade out completely

field.name: starColors
field.description: Array of star colors (if not specified, white is used).

field.name: starSprites
field.description:
Array of star sprites (any IBitmapDrawable-s; if not specified, StarField uses setPixel to draw a star).

Star sprites are affected by corresponding starColors value; for DisplayObject-s, StarField will use their blendMode to draw them.

field.name: stars
field.description: Array of Vertex - star coordinates data.

classRec.name: Sprite3D
classRec.description:
The Sprite3D class is used to create a 3D sprite.

A Sprite3D can be seen as a special Sprite2D.
It has an appearance that is a movie clip containing 360 frames (as maximum!) with texture.

Depending on the camera position, a different frame of the clip is shown, givin a 3D effect.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

method.name: Sprite3D
method.description: Creates a Sprite3D
method.param: p_sName A string identifier for this object
p_oContent The Movieclip containing the pre-rendered textures

p_nScale A number used to change the scale of the displayed object. In case that the object projected dimension isn't adapted to your needs. Default value is 1.0 which means unchanged. A value of 2.0 will double object size. A value of 0 will force original graphics size independent of distance.
p_nOffset A number between [0-360] to give angle offset into the clip.

method.name: content
method.description: The MovieClip that will used as content of this Sprite2D. If this MovieClip has already a scree position, it will be reseted to 0,0.
method.param: p_content The MovieClip to attach to the Sprite3D#container.

classRec.name: BBox
classRec.description:
The BBox class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.

It creates a bounding box that contains the whole object.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou
classRec.example: This example is taken from the Shape3D class. It is used in the updateBoundingVolumes() method: _oBBox = BBox.create( m_oGeometry.aVertex );

method.name: BBox
method.description: Creates a new BBox instance.
method.param: p_min A Point3D representing the lowest point of the cube volume.
p_max A Point3D representing the highest point of the cube volume.

method.name: clone
method.description: Returns a new BBox object that is a clone of the original instance.
method.return: A new BBox object that is identical to the original.

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a bounding box that encloses a 3D from an Array of the object's vertices.
method.param: p_aVertices The vertices of the 3D object the bounding box will contain.

method.name: getCenter
method.description: Returns the center of the bounding box volume.
method.return: A Point3D representing the center of the bounding box.

method.name: getSize
method.description: Returns the size of the bounding box.
method.return: A Point3D object representing the size of the volume in three dimensions.

method.name: merge
method.description: Merge the current BoundingBox with the one given in argument
method.param: pBounds The BBox object to merge the current BBox with

method.name: reset
method.description: Reset the current bounding box to an empoty box with 0,0,0 as max and min values

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.return: The fully qualified name of this object.

method.name: transform
method.description: Applies a transformation to the bounding box.
method.param: p_oMatrix The transformation matrix.

field.name: maxEdge
field.description: A Point3D representing the highest point of the cube volume.

field.name: minEdge
field.description: A Point3D representing the lowest point of the cube volume.

field.name: uptodate
field.description: Specifies if this object's boundaries are up to date with the object it is enclosing. If false, this object's transform() method must be called to get its updated boundaries in the current frame.

classRec.name: BSphere
classRec.description:
The BSphere class is used to quickly and easily clip an object in a 3D scene.

It creates a bounding sphere that contains the whole object
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou
classRec.example: This example is taken from the Shape3D class. It is used in the updateBoundingVolumes() method: _oBSphere = BSphere.create( m_oGeometry.aVertex );

method.name: BSphere
method.description: Creates a new BSphere instance.

method.name: compute
method.description: Computes of the bounding sphere's center and radius.
method.param: p_aVertices The vertices of the 3D object the bounding sphere will contain.

method.name: computeRadius
method.description: Computes the bounding sphere's radius.
method.param: p_aPoints An Array containing the bounding sphere's points.

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a bounding sphere that encloses a 3D from an Array of the object's vertices.
method.param: p_aVertices The vertices of the 3D object the bounding sphere will contain.

method.name: distance
method.description: Returns the distance of a Point3D from the surface of the bounding sphere. The number returned will be positive if the Point3D is outside the sphere, negative if inside, or 0 if on the surface of the sphere.
method.return: The distance from the bounding sphere to the Point3D.

method.name: pointsOutofSphere
method.description: Return the positions of the array of Position p that are outside the BoundingSphere.
method.param: An array containing the points to test
method.return: An array of points containing those that are outside. The array has a length of 0 if all the points are inside or on the surface.

method.name: reset
method.description: Reset the current bounding box to an empoty box with 0,0,0 as max and min values

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
method.return: The fully qualified name of this object.

method.name: transform
method.description: Applies a transformation to the bounding sphere.
method.param: p_oMatrix The transformation matrix.

field.name: center
field.description: A Point3D representing the center of the bounding sphere.

field.name: radius
field.description: The radius of the bounding sphere.

field.name: uptodate
field.description: Specifies if this object's boundaries are up to date with the object it is enclosing. If false, this object's transform() method must be called to get its updated boundaries in the current frame.

classRec.name: Light3D
classRec.description:
The Light3D class is used for creating the light of the world.

The light in Sandy is a light source at infinity, emitting parallel colored light. The direction, color, and intensity of the light can be changes.
classRec.author: Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou

Event.name: lightColorChanged
Event.description: Dispatched when the light color is changed.

Event.name: lightUpdated
Event.description: Dispatched when the light is updated.

method.name: Light3D
method.description: Creates a new light source.
method.param: p_oD The direction of the emitted light.
p_nPow The intensity of the emitted light.

method.name: calculate
method.description: Calculates the strength of this light based on the supplied normal.

method.name: destroy
method.description: Not in use...

method.name: getDirectionPoint3D
method.description: Returns the direction of the light.

method.name: getNormalizedPower
method.description: Returns the power of the light normalized to the range 0 -> 1

method.name: getPower
method.description: Returns the intensity of the light.
method.return: The intensity as a number between 0 - MAX_POWER.

method.name: setDirection
method.description: Uneeded? setDirectionPoint3D() does the same thing...
method.param: x The x coordinate
y The y coordinate
z The z coordinate

method.name: setDirectionPoint3D
method.description: Sets the direction of the Light3D.
method.param: x A Point3D object representing the direction of the light.

method.name: setPower
method.description: The the power of the light. A number between 0 and MAX_POWER is necessary. The highter the power of the light is, the less the shadows are visibles.
method.param: n Number a Number between 0 and MAX_POWER. This number is the light intensity.

method.name: color
method.description: The color of the light.

field.name: MAX_POWER
field.description: Maximum value accepted for the power of the light. Be aware that even if this constant is changed, the actual lighting calculations are normalized (0 - MAX_POWER becomes 0 -> 1).

field.name: changed
field.description: Public property which stores the modification of that light instance in case it changed. It is useful for the cache system

method.name: getTextLinks
method.description: Return an array of textlinks
method.param: t

Thomas PFEIFFER - kiroukou

classRec.author: Cedric Jules
Makc

method.name: clear

method.name: getHorizon
method.description: Returns the horizon value

method.name: setBitmap
method.description: Set the bitmap to apply as floor.
method.param: bmp The bitmapdata objet which contains floor texture information

method.name: setHorizon
method.description: Set the horizontal line display. you can use this to debug and/or to calibrate your visual elements

method.name: container

classRec.name: Extrusion
classRec.description: Very basic extrusion class.
classRec.author: makc

method.name: Extrusion
method.description: Extrudes 2D polygon.
method.param: name Shape name.
profile Polygon to extrude.
sections Array of transformation matrices.
closeFront Flag to close extrusion front end.
closeBack Flag to close extrusion back end.

method.name: backFace
method.description: Collection of polygons on the back surface of extruded shape. Texture is mapped to fit profile bounding box on this face.

method.name: frontFace
method.description: Collection of polygons on the front surface of extruded shape. Texture is mapped to fit profile bounding box on this face.

method.name: sideFace
method.description: Collection of polygons on the side surface of extruded shape. Texture U coordinate is mapped from 0 to 1 along the profile, and V coordinate is mapped from 0 at the front edge to 1 at the back edge.
